alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 3:02PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of , the east central City of Chesapeake and the central City of Virginia Beach through 345 PM EDT... At 302 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Princess Anne, or over Virginia Beach, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Princess Anne around 305 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Oceana, Rudee Heights, Mount Pleasant, Princess Anne Plaza, Sigma, Sandbridge Beach, Dam Neck, Oceana NAS, Gallups Corner and Macons Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
